definition: plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Won't the relaxed dress code damage the company image?
sentences.chinese: 难道这种善于便服的着装规定不会损害公司形象吗？

sentences.english: I see. Casual clothes are good for outings.
sentences.chinese: 我明白了，便服有利于郊游。

sentences.english: When I purchase my next casual wear, I will choose Brand A.
sentences.chinese: 下次购买便服的时候，我会选择品牌甲。

sentences.english: Donning a smoking jacket and bow tie seems the least one can do.
sentences.chinese: 身穿一件便服，戴一个领结似乎是最起码的了。

sentences.english: I prefer the earth in civvies.
He went to a locker room for his street clothes , and returned.
sentences.chinese: 他走到更衣室去换上自己的便服，然后又走了回来。

definition: long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
